data.title: Educational Philosophy of Nyerere
data.meta_description: Educational Philosophy of Nyerere - Free download as PDF File (.pdf), Text File (.txt) or read online for free. Nyerere was the first president of Tanzania who advocated for an education system that rejected the colonial model imposed by the British and returned to traditional African values. He believed Western education alienated Africans from their culture and promoted individualism over community. Nyerere proposed Ujamaa, or "familyhood", a form of African socialism based on cooperation, equality, and sharing resources for the benefit of all. He wanted education to instill these principles and empower people to liberate themselves from colonial mentality. Nyerere's philosophy significantly impacted education across Africa by promoting culturally relevant learning that preserved indigenous knowledge and traditions.
